title: 2014: 40 Essential EPs From 2014 (Part I)
body:
### **[Part I](http://admin.

crackintheroad.com/music/30380-2014-40-essential-eps-2014-part) / [Part II](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/30394-2014-40-essential-eps-2014-part-ii) //// [Spotify Playlist](http://open.spotify.com/user/joshmdalton/playlist/7HBVYRZJp17Y3OMSuFjogw)** In alphabetical order, and featuring a highlight from each EP. Follow the links to grab the full EPs, or check out the [Spotify playlist](http://open.spotify.com/user/joshmdalton/playlist/7HBVYRZJp17Y3OMSuFjogw) for a preview of each. ### **Part I / Part II** **abhi//dijon** – _EP_ From relative unknowns to one of 2014’s most likely to hit the big time, abhi//dijon’s August free download self-titled EP is equal proves smooth and wistfully romantic. Free download from [here](http://www.mediafire.com/download/a9h66oinpp4qzr9/abhi..dijon.rar). **AKW** – _To Be Alive_ Yet another beautiful release from LA trio AKW, centred around their finest outing yet, The Hunt. [Bandcamp](https://akwsound.bandcamp.com/). **Aquilo** – _Human_ Ludicrously talented duo Aquilo released two EPs in 2014, the second, Human, showing further progression of their effortless haunting sound. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/human-ep/id932499376?ign-mpt=uo%3D4) **Banoffee** – _s/t_ Possibly the brightest rising star from Australia’s blossoming electronic-pop scene, Banoffee’s self-titled EP is deliriously addictive. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/banoffee-ep/id909494692) **Ben Khan** – _1992_ Potentially my favourite EP of 2014; Youth is a truly game-changing track. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/1992-ep/id843286438?ign-mpt=uo%3D4) **Billie Black **– _000100_ Few artists encapsulate the ‘now’ as much as Billie Black, and her 000100 EP hinted at even more to come. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/000-100-ep/id935758227) **Billie Marten** – _Ribbon_ One of the essential voices of 2014 with one of the finest EP releases of the year. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/ribbon-ep/id880257404) **Black Honey **– _EP_ Brighton’s finest new band of the year with four tracks of melodic indie-rock and roll, part Yeah Yeah Yeahs, part Skins episode. (Only available at shows) **Blaue Blume **– _Beau & Lorette_ Falsetto led, Smiths inspired Danes with a fine ear for a killer hook. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/beau-lorette-ep/id884023932) **Broods **– _EP_ Now with an album under their belts, their EP released at the turn of the year is still the most coherent realisation of their sound. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/broods-ep/id797086387) **Bully – **_s/t_ Initially released at the tail end of 2013, their signing with Star Time saw a re-release alongside new track, Milkman. One of my tips for 2015. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/bully-ep/id927582567) / [Bandcamp](http://bullythemusic.bandcamp.com/album/bully-ep) **Cathedrals **– _s/t_ San Francisco dream-pop duo made quite the mark on 2014, with their fantastically received debut release. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/cathedrals-ep/id913343715?ign-mpt=uo%3D4) / [Vinyl](http://neon-gold-shop.myshopify.com/products/cathedrals-ep) **Cloud Castle Lake **– _Dandelion_ Gorgeously textured, Radiohed indebted first release from this Irish trio. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/dandelion-ep/id904640877) / [Vinyl](http://www.happyvalleyrecords.bigcartel.com/product/dandelion-ep) **East of Ely **– _s/t_ Stadium tempting, fell good anthems from Sydney outfit East Of Ely, with choruses that Foster the People would kill for. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/east-of-ely-ep/id926304279) **Elder Island **– _EP_ Funky, ambitious odd-pop from the Bristol trio; a delightfully endearing release. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/elder-island-ep/id874960777) **Formation ** – _EP_ London twins Formation announced their arrival with this disco inspired self-titled EP, only available in 12″, creating waves despite their minimal online presence. [Vinyl](http://www.piccadillyrecords.com/products/Formation-FormationEPInc.GroupeDeRockRemix-Formation-97791.html) (EP not available online, however check out their new single, Young Ones) **Huntar **– _Bitter_ Keeping info to a minimum, Huntar’s debut EP centred itself around the release of stunning single, Bitter. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/bitter-ep/id929701070) **Jack Garratt **– _Remnants_ A surprise omission from BBC’s Sound of 2015, Garratt’s Remnants EP marked him out as one of this years essential songwriters. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/remnants-ep/id929325397) **Kilo Kish **– _Across_ Bold, vibrant yet soulful R&B from Chet Faker collaborator Kilo Kish. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/across-ep/id890931287) **Klo **– _Cusp_ Aussie cousins Klo helped fill the temporary void left by Grimes and Purity Ring on their ambitious first outing. [iTunes](https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/cusp-ep/id935967441)
